meanings.definition: The quality or state of being mediocre.
meanings.sent1: In a world full of excellence, he was surrounded by mediocrities.
meanings.sent2: The mediocrities of the team were evident in their lackluster performance.
meanings.sent3: The mediocrities of the painting made it look like a child's finger-painting.
meanings.sent4: The mediocrities of the movie left the audience feeling unimpressed and bored.
meanings.sent5: Her mediocrities in cooking were overshadowed by her exceptional baking skills.

meanings.definition: A person of mediocre ability or achievement.
meanings.sent1: She was considered one of the mediocrities in the office, never standing out.
meanings.sent2: The team was filled with mediocrities who struggled to meet their targets.
meanings.sent3: The mediocrities in the talent show made the judges question their selection process.
meanings.sent4: He saw himself as a mediocrity in the world of sports, always coming in last.
meanings.sent5: The mediocrities in the classroom were overshadowed by the few exceptional students.
